snippet: The bloody repression of the student protest on Thursday by Syrian forces further eroded a truce negotiated under United Nations auspices.
abstract: Violent clampdown by Syrian security forces against a student demonstration at Aleppo University in Aleppo, Syria, ends with at least four students killed and scores arrested; bloody repression ignites more rallies and further erodes a truce negotiated under United Nations auspices that affirmed the right to hold peaceful protests.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The bloody repression of the student protest on Thursday by Syrian forces further eroded a truce negotiated under United Nations auspices.

headline.seo: Crackdown in Aleppo, Syria, Leaves Students Dead
headline.main: Forces Storm University in Syria During Protest, Killing at Least 4, Activists Say
headline.print_headline: Forces Storm University in Syria During Protest, Killing at Least 4, Activists Say

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
